subject: Relationships
title: Learning What You Really Need in Love
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Learning What You Really Need in Love.

hook.text: Every failed relationship teaches you something your succeeded ones can't: what you actually need.

buildup.text: Breakups clarify non-negotiables. After enough pain, you stop compromising on what truly matters to you.

discovery.text: Research shows people who reflect on breakups choose more compatible partners in subsequent relationships.

twist.text: The danger is over-correcting. Choosing the 'opposite' of your ex isn't wisdom â€” it's reaction disguised as growth.

climax.text: A breakup is data. It tells you what worked, what didn't, and what you can't live without.

punchline.text: Breakups teach you what you need â€” if you're willing to learn.

quiz.question: How do breakups improve future relationships?
options: Reflection leads to choosing more compatible partners
